title: Implement Poisson distribution, added Distributions.cu, CUDAGenerator
body_html:
This is a port of probtorch#58. Thanks to @apaszke and @fritzo for making a pass already.

Unfortunately the most recent change (using scalar templating to get the right return type) causes it not to compile, so if anyone knows why I would love some help. The specific error is:

aten/src/THC/THCNumerics.cuh(686): error: no suitable constructor exists to convert from "const unsigned int" to "at::Half"
body_text:
This is a port of probtorch#58. Thanks to @apaszke and @fritzo for making a pass already.
Unfortunately the most recent change (using scalar templating to get the right return type) causes it not to compile, so if anyone knows why I would love some help. The specific error is:
aten/src/THC/THCNumerics.cuh(686): error: no suitable constructor exists to convert from "const unsigned int" to "at::Half"
body:
This is a port of https://github.com/probtorch/pytorch/pull/58. Thanks to @apaszke and @fritzo for making a pass already. 

Unfortunately the most recent change (using `scalar` templating to get the right return type) causes it not to compile, so if anyone knows why I would love some help. The specific error is:
```
aten/src/THC/THCNumerics.cuh(686): error: no suitable constructor exists to convert from "const unsigned int" to "at::Half"
```
